tit.e: Araumi-no-shoji (sliding screens on which various images are painted including araumi (a rough sea))
tit.cmt: タイトルなので補足を削除しました。読みは原文に合わせました。

sen.j: 荒海障子（あらうみのそうじ）は、清涼殿弘廂の東北端にたてられていた、布張りの衝立障子。
sen.e: Araumi-no-shoji is an upholstered Tsuitate shoji (a partitioning screen, sometimes an opaque panel screen or sometimes a wooden screen set in a stand) set up at the end of northeast of Hirobisashi of Seiryo-den Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: 原文の読みは「あらうみのそうじ」となっていますが、「しょうじ」が一般的だと考え、用語集通りにしています。
sen.e: Araumi no soji (also referred as Araumi no shoji) is an upholstered Tsuitate shoji (a partitioning screen, sometimes an opaque panel screen or sometimes a wooden screen set in a stand) set up at the end of northeast of Hiro-bisashi (broad eaves) of Seiryoden (Literally, Limpid Cool Hall, an Imperial summer palace).
sen.cmt: 半角文字にし、一般的な読みなどを補足しました。
sen.e: Araumi no soji (also referred as Araumi no shoji) is an upholstered Tsuitate shoji (a partitioning screen, sometimes an opaque panel screen or sometimes a wooden screen set in a stand) set up at the end of northeast of Hiro-bisashi (broad eaves) of Seiryoden (Literally, Limpid Cool Hall, an Imperial summer palace).

sen.cmt: メートルのみ表示しました。

sen.j: 墨で、表の南面には、荒海の中島に手長人、足長人のいる図、裏に、宇治の網代で氷魚をすなどる図がかいてあった。
sen.e: It had black ink pictures of a Tenagajin (man who has long arms) and an Ashinagajin (man who has long legs) on an island in a rough sea on the south side of its front and a picture of a Hiuo (sweetfish fry) fisherman in an ajiro (wickerwork) in Uji on the back.

On the south side of its front, it had black ink pictures of a Tenagajin (man who has long arms) and an Ashinagajin (man who has long legs) on an island in a rough sea, and on the back, a picture of a Hiuo (sweetfish fry) fisherman in an ajiro (wickerwork) in Uji.

sen.j: 『枕草子』、『太平記』に言及されている。
sen.e: Araumi-no-shoji was described in "Makura no soshi" (the Pillow Book) and "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace).
